job_title: Disability Support Worker in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Great flexibility for hours, lots of work available.
cons: High employee turnover. Shifts can be slow if you like to stay busy at work.

review_title: Great place to work to learn new skills

job_title: Disability Support Worker in Winnipeg, MB
pros:
relaxing workplace
some residential services place have free food
cons:
Day service manager is difficult to deal with, extremely disconnected with the person supported. Using their imagination to judge how you work.

Low pay, no advancement. the staring wages for DSW is $13.35, after 5 years, you will reach the gap at $15.44

job_title: Disability Service Worker in Winnipeg, MB
pros: If you're a casual, flexible with advance notice.
cons:
Management appears nice, but in practice is underhanded and secretive. They funnel money funded specifically to staff certain people into unknown areas. A number of people have left after 20 years of working here after the management switched and I wished I had known this before starting to work here. 
The pay is low. The union is about to go on strike.

pros: The people we provide supports to are awesome.
cons: Pay does not come close to work load
